initial_question.title: How to generate several images at one time by main.py(lora)
initial_question.body:
I don't see some parameters represents the number of the image
so how can i modify the `forward` function to generate such as 4 images at one time?

satisfaction_conditions: Multiple images can be generated in a single execution
User can specify desired number of output images
Solution integrates with existing main.py/Lora framework

initial_question.title: How to train Flux LoRa with a local model dir?
initial_question.body:
I download the model to my local dir (following the file structure of the flux repo), so i wanna use the local dir to train flux instead of downloading model by the procedure.
I think it's easier to manage. 
How can I do it? I tried to modify the code but failed
I will be grateful if you can solve the problem

satisfaction_conditions: Environment variables must be properly configured to point to local model files
Model loader must correctly identify and load both CLIP and T5 models from local paths
Required model files must be present in the local directory structure
Model loading mechanism must maintain original functionality while using local files
